result.execSummary:
The defendant Tammy Annette Sam was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Abuse-Intentionally Cause Harm, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(2)(b).
  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tammy Annette Sam

records.addlTxt:
1:10 PM Defendant Tammy Annette Sam in court, in custody.  Attorney Chris A Gramstrup in court for Tammy Annette Sam.  Attorney Jennifer Gross in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances.  State recites agreement, all parties agree.  Through Counsel, DEF enters NC Plea to Count 1 and 2.  DEF advised of rights and penalties; DEF waives rights; parties stipulate to facts.  Court accepts plea to Count 1 and 2, and finds DEF guilty.  Count 3 and 4 are dismissed and read in.  State has complied with victim rights.  Court finds Victim Rights Legislation has been complied with.   State makes sentencing argument, request court to follow recommendation.  Attny Gramstrup makes sentencing argument, request to follow agreement.   DEF makes statement to court.   Court addresses DEF.  

COURT:
Count 1:  withheld sentence:  3 years probation:  Conditions of probation: 60 days county jail.  86 days jail credit.  TIME SERVED.   AODA assessment  within 45 days and follow-through with recommendations.  Mental Health Assessment.   Court Costs. DEF must provide DNA sample and pay applicable $250 surcharge. 

Count 2:   withheld sentence:  3 years probation:  Conditions of probation:  AODA assessment  within 45 days and follow-through with recommendations.  Mental Health Assessment.   Court Costs. DEF must provide DNA sample and pay applicable $200 surcharge.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 17, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

09:36 AM Defendant Tammy Annette Sam in court with attorney Christian J Ness appears by zoom.  Defendant Tammy Annette Sam in custody appears by video.  Jennifer Gross appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls case and recites appearances.  Attny Ness acknowledges information, waives formal reading.  DEF enters NG plea to Count 1.  Court finds probable cause and binds DEF over for trial.    Attny Ness indicates global resolution, and resuests plea/sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 17, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

10:48 AM Defendant Tammy Annette Sam in court with attorney Christian J Ness appears by zoom.  Defendant Tammy Annette Sam in custody appears by video.  Jennifer Gross appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Attny Ness  indicates to proceed with preliminary hearing.    State calls witness, LCO Officer Junker, sworn in by court.   State begins examination.   10:50 AM Witness identified the DEF.  State continues examination.  10:53 AM  Cross-Examination by Attorney Ness.  Attny Ness no further questions.  10:54 AM  Witness excused.   No further witness by either party.   State makes argument and request for bind over.  Attny Ness no argument to probably cause, but makes argument to domestic abuse enhance.  Court finds probable cause and binds defendant over for trial. 

Attny Ness request to address bond.  State does not object to hear bond argument.  Attny Ness makes argument.  State objects to request for bond modification.  DEF makes statement to court.  Court addresses DEF and Attny regarding treatment.   Court denies bond modification.  Arraignment scheduled for April 5, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on March 11, 2022 at 10:45 am.

08:50 AM Defendant Tammy Annette Sam in court with attorney Christian J Ness.  Defendant Tammy Annette Sam in custody appears by video.  Jennifer Gross appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Court calls case and recites appearances.  DEF received copy of criminal complaint in court on this date.  DEF verifies DOB and address.  Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading of complaint.   Attny Ness recently appointed to case, unable to review criminal complaint with client, Court reviews.   Court enters NG Plea to all Count.   Attny Ness request preliminary hearing within time limits.  Atty Ness gives notice for motion of modification of bond.  Court sets preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 11, 2022 at 10:45 am.
